relation: "Siya Na Nga Kaya?" (Love theme from Dyesebel)
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {4199=The group, consisting of both boys and girls, were formed in 2006 from the former QTV 11 (now GMA News TV) variety talent show, Popstar Kids., 4726=The group was disbanded in 2009 due to the reformatting of SOP Rules, which was replaced by Party Pilipinas., 6345=In late 2011 to early 2012, Vanessa Rangadhol joined MYMP as its lead vocalist after Juliet Bahala left the group.}
textBeforeTable: Sugarpop Albums[edit] Discography[edit] Rita Daniela Vanessa Rangadhol Julie Anne San Jose Renzo Almario Pocholo Bismonte Members[edit] Male members Pocholo and Renzo have remained inactive. The SugarPop girls were recently in a vocal group battle production number on Party Pilipinas with another of the country's trios, La Diva. In late 2011 to early 2012, Vanessa Rangadhol joined MYMP as its lead vocalist after Juliet Bahala left the group. Rita Iringan (who now goes by the name Rita De Guzman) rejoined her fellow SugarPop mate in Party Pilipinas, also with minor TV roles. She also auditioned for the staging of Miss Saigon in the Philippines. Julie Anne San Jose remained with the defunct SOP Rules and continued to be one of the divas of Party Pilipinas. She was also paired up with Elmo Magalona, and they were dubbed JuliElmo, as one of the prominent love teams of GMA 7. She has not only starred in the variety show but had also appeared in
